content:
• Tuesday, April 3, 2012
  • TAP

    Molson Coors (TAP -5.4%) fell sharply following its $3.5B deal to acquire StarBev, and the cool...

    Molson Coors (TAP -5.4%) fell sharply following its $3.5B deal to acquire StarBev, and the cool reaction from ratings agencies likely played a role. Moody's lowered its rating on Molson, which has $2.3B in debt, to Baa2 (a notch below investment-grade), noting beer consumption in StarBev's markets is often volatile during recessions. Fitch argues the deal isn't enough to allow Molson to challenge BUD and other Euro market leaders. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • HEAT

    SmartHeat (HEAT +91.6%) shares nearly doubled today on 40x the usual volume, despite a Q4 loss...

    SmartHeat (HEAT +91.6%) shares nearly doubled today on 40x the usual volume, despite a Q4 loss on write-downs in two acquired businesses. The China-based company that sells plate heat exchangers said a slowdown in end-market demand would be temporary and promised a "rigorous program of cost cutting" to maintain control of its budget.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) -6.1% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $1.2B, below a guidance range of...

    SanDisk (SNDK) -6.1% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $1.2B, below a guidance range of $1.3B-$1.35B. The NAND flash memory vendor, which blames the shortfall on weak pricing and demand, also says its gross margin will be below a guidance range of 39%-42%. Rival Micron (NASDAQ:MU), which mentioned seeing weak NAND pricing during last month's FQ2 earnings call, is down 1.1% in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 4 Comments
  • WPZ

    Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) -3.5% AH after announcing a new 9M share stock offering, good for...

    Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) -3.5% AH after announcing a new 9M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $506.7M based on today's close. Unsurprisingly, Williams will use part of the proceeds to fund its $2.5B purchase of Caiman Midstream. The news comes just a few days after parent company Williams (NYSE:WMB) priced a 26M share offering, with plans to use the proceeds to help finance the Caiman deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • GM

    Sales figures for new vehicles at the big three U.S. automakers (I, II, III) topped year-ago...

    Sales figures for new vehicles at the big three U.S. automakers (I, II, III) topped year-ago levels and were near their best levels since before the financial crisis, but General Motors (GM -4.6%) lagged Edmunds.com estimates, posting 12% sales growth in March vs. 21% predicted. Ford (F +0.2%) and Chrysler (FIATY.PK -2%) were in-line.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • VSH

    Vishay Intertechnology (NYSE:VSH) +1.6% AH after announcing it amended its credit agreement. The...

    Vishay Intertechnology (NYSE:VSH) +1.6% AH after announcing it amended its credit agreement. The new deal increases the chipmaker's total credit facility commitments by $78M to $528M, with the new funds carrying the same terms and conditions as existing commitments. As of Dec. 31, Vishay had $399M in debt on its balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q4 EPS of $0.77 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $37M (+88% Y/Y)...

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND): Q4 EPS of $0.77 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $37M (+88% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares +5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • HOV

    Shares of Hovnanian (NYSE:HOV) move 4.9% lower AH after the firm announces an offering of 25M...

    Shares of Hovnanian (NYSE:HOV) move 4.9% lower AH after the firm announces an offering of 25M shares of its common stock with an over-allotment allowance of an extra 15% for underwriters.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -4.6%) announces it sold 49.4M shares in its secondary offering (insider sales) at...

    Zynga (ZNGA -4.6%) announces it sold 49.4M shares in its secondary offering (insider sales) at $12/share. That's 6.4M shares more than what Zynga officially priced last week, the result of underwriters exercising options to purchase additional shares. All those extra shares may have contributed to today's selloff in Zynga, which closed at $12.29.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • ONXX

    Shares of Onyx Pharma (ONXX +3.2%) jump after Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) said a Phase III trial showed...

    Shares of Onyx Pharma (ONXX +3.2%) jump after Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) said a Phase III trial showed its drug regorafenib prevented gastrointestinal tumors from worsening, and the German drug giant will seek regulatory approval for the medicine based on the data. Bayer is paying Onyx a 20% royalty for the use of the drug in oncology.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (GNC +3.1%) moves up after BMO Capital raises its rating to to Outperform on...

    GNC Holdings (GNC +3.1%) moves up after BMO Capital raises its rating to to Outperform on valuation, citing an improving ROIC, better cash flow and top line growth. The firm also raises its price target to $42 from $35.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • FSLR

    As another round of solar bankruptcies hits the news, First Solar (FSLR -7.8%) shares skid to...

    As another round of solar bankruptcies hits the news, First Solar (FSLR -7.8%) shares skid to new multi-year lows, dragging down other solar stocks (TAN -3%) despite sunny views from Suntech's CEO. 24/7's Jon Ogg points to Wall Street estimates: "Margins in the sector have been compressing to the point that we just do not believe" the consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • HTCH

    Shares of Hutchinson Technology (HTCH -3.2%) drop off after the firm files a registration...

    Shares of Hutchinson Technology (HTCH -3.2%) drop off after the firm files a registration statement with the SEC to sell up to 3.869M shares of its common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM

  • Dollar-sensitive commodities aren't spared the damage from news additional QE isn't right around...

    Dollar-sensitive commodities aren't spared the damage from news additional QE isn't right around the corner. Gold -1.7% to $1,651, WTI crude -1.3% to $103.84, copper -0.8% to $3.89.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -5.4%) falls again due to a web site taking a critical look at its finances....

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -5.4%) falls again due to a web site taking a critical look at its finances. Only this time, the source isn't Citron Research, but Forbes' Richard Pearson, who expects auditor Deloitte to conduct a demanding review of Qihoo's books in 2012, and whose research raises serious questions about Qihoo's ad sales efforts. Qihoo, whose shares could also be affected by the release of a rival browser, is once again denying the allegations.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • TRQ

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN -8.6%) dives following a downgrade to Reduce from TD Securities. While...

    Ivanhoe Mines (IVN -8.6%) dives following a downgrade to Reduce from TD Securities. While considering Chalco's (NYSE:ACH) offer for subsidiary SouthGobi a positive, the firm also notes Ivanhoe recently filed a downbeat technical report about its Oyu Tolgoi project, one that suggests expenses will be higher than previously forecast, and production at a specific mine will take longer than expected to start.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +2.9%) kick up a gain after a flood of auto sales reports tips off...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +2.9%) kick up a gain after a flood of auto sales reports tips off that fuel-efficient cars are gaining more favor with consumers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • BB

    "My Gnome is hearing that all bidders have walked from RIMM," tweets Doug Kass, and in doing so...

    "My Gnome is hearing that all bidders have walked from RIMM," tweets Doug Kass, and in doing so contributes to today's selloff in Research In Motion (RIMM -7.6%). Gene Munster did his part courtesy of a CNBC appearance (video).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 9 Comments
  • KERX

    Ladenburg piles into Keryx's (KERX -10.3%) bad day, downgrading the shares to Neutral after the...

    Ladenburg piles into Keryx's (KERX -10.3%) bad day, downgrading the shares to Neutral after the company said yesterday that its perifosine phase III trial missed its primary endpoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • ALGT

    Bags don't fly free: Allegiant Travel (ALGT +2.3%) ups the ante on charging passengers fees with...

    Bags don't fly free: Allegiant Travel (ALGT +2.3%) ups the ante on charging passengers fees with a new policy tagging customers with a $35 hit for carry-on bags requiring overhead bin space due to their size. The move could set off a chain reaction among major carriers - not entirely satisfied with the record $32.5B haul the industry took in for ancillary fees last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • UFS

    Shares of Domtar (UFS +4.1%) ride an upgrade from Credit Suisse higher. Analysts with the firm...

    Shares of Domtar (UFS +4.1%) ride an upgrade from Credit Suisse higher. Analysts with the firm cite a "landmark" 15-year supply agreement that Domtar signed with Appleton Papers and higher prices for pulp as revenue drivers for the firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • SGMS

    Roth Capital says Scientific Games (SGMS +1.8%) will likely beat Q1 expectations, and raises...

    Roth Capital says Scientific Games (SGMS +1.8%) will likely beat Q1 expectations, and raises estimates, citing an increase in online lottery sales following two very large multi-state lottery jackpots.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • ETFC

    Online brokers E-Trade (ETFC -2%) and Charles Schwab (SCHW -0.7%) slide after Sandler...

    Online brokers E-Trade (ETFC -2%) and Charles Schwab (SCHW -0.7%) slide after Sandler O’Neill's Rich Repetto says retail trading at online firms fell 5%-10% M/M in March: "We suspect March retail trading generally underperformed consolidated industry share volumes, which were down 5.1% sequentially,” Repetto says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • GPI

    Buckingham Research hikes its ratings to Buy on auto retailers Group 1 (GPI +4.4%), Asbury (ABG...

    Buckingham Research hikes its ratings to Buy on auto retailers Group 1 (GPI +4.4%), Asbury (ABG +3.7%) and Penske (PAG +4.3%) as the best way to play a recovery in U.S. light vehicle sales. "Auto retailers tend to experience strong stock performance during the second quarter, with auto retailer stocks increasing 20% on average during the 2002-2011 period."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • BIO

    Bio-Rad Labs (BIO +12.3%) shares surge after the company says it has extended its marketing deal...

    Bio-Rad Labs (BIO +12.3%) shares surge after the company says it has extended its marketing deal with research tool maker Luminex (LMNX +0.2%). Under the deal, BIO will hold the worldwide sales and distribution rights to LMNX's Magpix multiplexing instrument.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • FFIV

    F5 (FFIV +1.3%) makes new 52-week highs after Merrill's Tai Liani raises her PT to $145, arguing...

    F5 (FFIV +1.3%) makes new 52-week highs after Merrill's Tai Liani raises her PT to $145, arguing the maker of application delivery controller (ADC) switches will also benefit (previously) from Intel's Romley server CPU launch. Romley's integrated 10-Gig interfaces and ability to support extra virtual servers could lead to a greater need for F5's ADCs in cloud and virtualization environments, Liani argues, and so could mobile data demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • STZ

    Wine seller Constellation Brands (STZ +2.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral by Goldman Sachs...

    Wine seller Constellation Brands (STZ +2.8%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral by Goldman Sachs with a revised $29 price target, up from $22. The firm cites improving wine fundamentals, compelling capital allocation potential with an expected $300M-plus of share buybacks per year in FY13 and beyond, and a sum-of-the-parts valuation of $29.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM -2.4%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation at Citigroup...

    Newmont Mining (NEM -2.4%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation at Citigroup earlier this morning, citing as a catalyst risks to the company's 7M oz. production target. The firm also lowers its price target to $56 from $80.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) moves up 2.8%, helped along in part by word that Eddie Lampert will regale...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) moves up 2.8%, helped along in part by word that Eddie Lampert will regale the CNBC crew tomorrow morning with his presence in the studio. The trimmed-down retailing chain keeps defying the shorts not yet squeezed out with a dizzying 115% YTD return.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 8 Comments
  • BB

    Herb Greenberg calls chatter kickstarted by Piper Jaffray's Gene Munster on a Research In Motion...

    Herb Greenberg calls chatter kickstarted by Piper Jaffray's Gene Munster on a Research In Motion (RIMM -5.1%) bankruptcy absurd given the tech firm's balance sheet and cash flow.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 11 Comments
  • GPN

    Global Payments (GPN +2.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus, saying the stock has...

    Global Payments (GPN +2.4%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus, saying the stock has overreacted to the security breach news. The firm notes that fundamental exposure is much lower than the market is discounting, and valuation will recover.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • AAPL

    Piper's Gene Munster isn't the only Apple (AAPL +2.1%) perma-bull giving its shares a lift...

    Piper's Gene Munster isn't the only Apple (AAPL +2.1%) perma-bull giving its shares a lift today. JPMorgan's Mark Moskowitz (previously) is raising his PT to $715, arguing his firm's research indicates iPhone/iPad shipment activity within the supply chain "implies major upside potential" to prior estimates. In addition, Auriga's Kevin Dede is starting coverage with a Buy and $700 PT, while praising Apple for having an unmatched app ecosystem.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • ABG

    A number of auto industry-related stocks are running hot amid reports from manufacturers of...

    A number of auto industry-related stocks are running hot amid reports from manufacturers of brisk March auto sales. Advancers: ABG +4.4%, GPI +4.3%, PAG +5.0%, SAH +4.3%, LAD +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • FAST

    Fastenal (FAST -0.7%) dips after William Blair downgraded the shares to Market Perform on...

    Fastenal (FAST -0.7%) dips after William Blair downgraded the shares to Market Perform on valuation, noting recent insider selling (I, II) as a catalyst.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • MRVL

    William Blair defends Cavium Networks (CAVM +3%) this morning, saying the stock should be bought...

    William Blair defends Cavium Networks (CAVM +3%) this morning, saying the stock should be bought on any weakness, and to use the company's guidance reduction yesterday as a buying opportunity. The firm believes 2012 will be a good year for the company and maintains its Outperform rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -11.4%) crashes into penny stock territory after getting hit with a series of...

    A123 Systems (AONE -11.4%) crashes into penny stock territory after getting hit with a series of class-action suits, apparently related to last month's battery recall. Yesterday, the cash-strapped company fell on news customer Fisker Automotive had obtained new funding - investors weren't identified, but A123 has poured money into Fisker before.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 1 Comment
  • LCAV

    LCA-Vision (LCAV +8%) reports 20,989 laser vision correction procedures were performed during...

    LCA-Vision (LCAV +8%) reports 20,989 laser vision correction procedures were performed during Q1, an 11% Y/Y increase that marks LCAV's third straight quarter of total procedure growth. Upon the news, Maxim Group issues a Buy rating on the shares. LCAV is expected to report Q1 earnings April 24.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • TEN

    Wells Fargo makes a couple valuation changes to its Priority Stock list this morning. The firm...

    Wells Fargo makes a couple valuation changes to its Priority Stock list this morning. The firm adds Tenneco (TEN +1.4%), raising Q1 EPS estimates and increasing its price range to $42 - $47 from $39 - $44, and cuts BorgWarner (BWA +0.7%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • HAIN

    All the fuss over Annie's impressive post-IPO run up in share price hasn't hurt health food...

    All the fuss over Annie's impressive post-IPO run up in share price hasn't hurt health food rival Hain Celestial (HAIN +3.1%) one bit. Shares now trade at a 52-week high after trekking north with BNNY.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM +12.1%) posts a double-digit gain after announcing a joint venture with Bunge...

    Solazyme (SZYM +12.1%) posts a double-digit gain after announcing a joint venture with Bunge Limited (BG -1.1%) to operate a commercial-scale renewable oil facility in Brazil. The new operation will combine Solazyme’s renewable tailored oil production technology with Bunge’s sugarcane supply and processing capabilities to produce sustainable oils for use in chemical and fuel applications in Brazil.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • BNNY

    Annie's (BNNY +9.7%), which skyrocketed after going public last week, jumps again on another...

    Annie's (BNNY +9.7%), which skyrocketed after going public last week, jumps again on another positive mention from Jim Cramer (previously). Cramer argued on last night's broadcast of Mad Money Annie's is still cheaper than rival Hain Celestial (HAIN +1.9%), and says the end of the company's quiet period and the arrival of positive analyst commentary will help drive shares higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • FDO

    Shares of Family Dollar Stores (FDO +1.5%) trade higher after Buckingham Research lifts its...

    Shares of Family Dollar Stores (FDO +1.5%) trade higher after Buckingham Research lifts its rating to Buy all the way from Underperform. Analysts add $25 to their previous price target to take it up to $78 - repping 23% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • STP

    Suntech Power (STP +0.8%) CEO Zhengrong Shi tells Reuters his company expects to return to...

    Suntech Power (STP +0.8%) CEO Zhengrong Shi tells Reuters his company expects to return to profit, along with the entire industry, by Q4 as prices stabilize on tighter inventories and improving demand. Global solar companies such as Suntech, FSLR -1.8%, TSL +1% CSIQ -1.2% all reported losses for 2011 due to aggressive pricing and a supply glut eroding margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • UEC

    Uranium Energy (NYSEMKT:UEC) -6.5% premarket after announcing plans to sell 5.56M shares of its...

    Uranium Energy (NYSEMKT:UEC) -6.5% premarket after announcing plans to sell 5.56M shares of its common stock to the public to raise up to $20M. UEC says it will use the proceeds to fund exploration and development expenditures at its projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

  • Market Preview: Stock futures are mixed, with the S&P 500 benchmark -0.2% after hitting a...

    Market Preview: Stock futures are mixed, with the S&P 500 benchmark -0.2% after hitting a 4-year high in the previous session. CVR Energy +6.5% as Carl Icahn looks set to win his battle for the refiner. Later: ISM New York Business Index, Factory Orders, FOMC minutes
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • AZO

    AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) +1.7% premarket after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Conviction Buy from...

    AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) +1.7% premarket after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Conviction Buy from Neutral and raises its price target to $435 from $405. The firm says AZO's commercial ramp "represents one of the single biggest predictable revenue drivers at any company in our coverage," and AZO is well positioned to meet or exceed expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • XSPA

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG) shoot up another 6.5% premarket, following up on a 86% gainer yesterday...

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG) shoot up another 6.5% premarket, following up on a 86% gainer yesterday on the heels of a article from James Altucher over the weekend speculating on the value of a patent infringment case against the search giant.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • KERX

    Shares of Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) shed 2.2% premarket after taking on a number of...

    Shares of Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) shed 2.2% premarket after taking on a number of downgrades from analysts. The cratering of shares this week following the failure of its Perifisone drug serves as a stark reminder of the great risk/reward tradeoff in the biotech/small pharma sector, according to VFC Stock House.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • D

    Dominion Resources (NYSE:D) -1.4% premarket after issuing downward Q1 guidance due to warm...

    Dominion Resources (NYSE:D) -1.4% premarket after issuing downward Q1 guidance due to warm weather that will lower EPS by an estimated $0.10-$0.11. D now sees EPS near the bottom of $0.85-$1.00 range, excluding non-recurring items, vs. $0.95 consensus; it reaffirms guidance for FY2012, sees EPS of $3.10-$3.35 vs. $3.22 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • URBN

    Citi turns more positive on Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) after digesting the firm's 10-K filed...

    Citi turns more positive on Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) after digesting the firm's 10-K filed with the SEC, raising its rating to Neutral from Sell and lifting its price target by $6 to $32. Analysts see Q1 figures for the retailer on more solid footing with a reduced risk of downward revisions. Shares +3.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) gets another $1K price target, this time from the "ax" on the stock, Gene...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) gets another $1K price target, this time from the "ax" on the stock, Gene Munster, who lifts his official target from $718 to $910, but says it could reach $1K in 2014. Shares +0.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 AM | 6 Comments
